newsitem.title: USA: Iron Mountain says helping fire customers.
newsitem.headline: Iron Mountain says helping fire customers.

text.p: Iron Mountain Inc said it is working closely with the about 200 customers affected by the fire at the company's South Brunswick, New Jersey, document storage facility.

The fire, which late Wednesday, caused extensive damage to the building that houses paper records and other documents, the company said. The fire is of suspicious orgin and is under investigation, the company added.

Iron Mountain said it has established temporary headquarters and document recovery services near the building, and that its customers will continue to be served by other company facilities in the New York and New Jersey areas.
The company said the fire destroyed about one million of the roughly 1.2 million cartons of paper records stored at the facility.
Iron Mountain stores billions of paper documents for a variety of corporate, government and institutional customers in 117 facilities nationwide.
